alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Darlington and central Marlboro Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clyde, or near Hartsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Hartsville, North Hartsville, Clyde, Dovesville, Auburn, Kellytown, Society Hill, Blenheim and Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
